intro: Stylogyne sordida, commonly known as the sordid stylogyne, is a perennial herb native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs with diverse ecological roles. The plant is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom during the wet season. Stylogyne sordida is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies on tropical flora and plant adaptation.
